Package pieces

Class King

java.lang.Object
pieces.Piece
pieces.King
public class King extends Piece
A subclass of Piece, this class contains King specific implementations of the methods standardMove(),updateLocation(), hasNoCollisions(), and generateMoves().
Author:
Julius Ramirez

  • Method Details

    • standardMove

      public boolean standardMove(int x, int y)
      Description copied from class: Piece
      This method returns a boolean depending on if the piece is moved in a way that it is intended to move, both state specific move or as it generally is moved.

      Due to the creation of generateMoves() this method could be entirely scrapped, however special moves such as en passant or castling have their fields updated accordingly during this method call and thus removal requires more structural changes.

      Specified by:
      standardMove in class Piece
      Parameters:
      x - any integer between 0-7 inclusive.
      y - any integer between 0-7 inclusive.
      Returns:
      true if the piece is moved in a legal way, false if not.

    • updateLocation

      public void updateLocation(int x, int y)
      This method updates the location of a the piece. The King's moved field is also set to true so castling may not be performed in future moves.
      Overrides:
      updateLocation in class Piece
      Parameters:
      x - any integer between 0-7 inclusive.
      y - any integer between 0-7 inclusive.

    • hasNoCollisions

      public boolean hasNoCollisions(int x, int y, Tile[][] tiles)
      Description copied from class: Piece
      Returns a boolean indicating if the piece collides with a friendly piece at the x/y coordinate. Enemy collisions are allowed.

      Due to the creation of generateMoves() this method could be entirely scrapped, however special moves such as en passant or castling have their fields updated accordingly during this method call and thus removal requires more structural changes.

      Specified by:
      hasNoCollisions in class Piece
      Parameters:
      x - any integer between 0-7 inclusive
      y - any integer between 0-7 inclusive
      tiles - a 2D list containing Tile objects which contain an accessible Piece field.
      Returns:
      true if no pieces are in the way, false if a piece would be blocking the move.

    • generateMoves

      public List<Coordinate> generateMoves(Tile[][] tiles)
      This method generates most of the valid moves a piece can do in terms of standard piece movement and no collisions made. It does NOT filter out non-valid check related moves (i.e. moves that keep the king in check/put the king in check).

      The castling move coordinate is generated in the King class, however due to the nature of the generateMoves() method two edge cases occur:

      1. If a piece is protecting their king from being in check and thus cannot move, the generateMoves() for that piece might still produce a coordinate that will prevent the other king from doing the castle move.

      2. A king will be able to castle even if the resulting location of the king allows it to be attacked by a pawn.

      Edge case two can be fixed by implementing helper methods that check for pawns in the corresponding locations, however case one involves more structural changes. A solution could be to pass the entire Chessboard object instead of the Tile array due to the Chessboard class implementing a validCheckMove() method and also a filterMoves() method, so when an opponents generateMoves() is called, those generated moves can be filtered, thus only valid moves will prevent castling from occuring.

      Specified by:
      generateMoves in class Piece
      Parameters:
      tiles - tiles a 2D list containing Tile objects which contain an accessible Piece field.
      Returns:
      a List of Coordinate objects which are spaces where the piece can possibly move.
      See Also:
      • Chessboard.validCheckMove(int, int, Piece, boolean)

    • blackCastlingHelper

      private void blackCastlingHelper(Tile[][] tiles, List<Coordinate> coordinates)
      This method is called within generateMoves() to determine if the king is able to castle. If the castling criteria has been met, the Rook's coordinate is added to the List containing possible moves.
      Parameters:
      tiles - a 2D array containing Tile objects which have an obtainable Piece field.
      coordinates - a List containing Coordinate objects that store's integers x and y

    • whiteCastlingHelper

      private void whiteCastlingHelper(Tile[][] tiles, List<Coordinate> coordinates)
      This method is called within generateMoves() to determine if the king is able to castle. If the castling criteria has been met, the Rook's coordinate is added to the List containing possible moves.
      Parameters:
      tiles - a 2D array containing Tile objects which have an obtainable Piece field.
      coordinates - a List containing Coordinate objects that store's integers x and y

    • hasFriendlyRook

      private boolean hasFriendlyRook(int x, int y, Tile[][] tiles)
      This helper method is used within the castling helper methods to determine if a corner tile contains a friendly Rook.
      Parameters:
      x - an integer equaling either 0 or 7
      y - an integer equaling either 0 or 7
      tiles - a 2D array containing Tile objects which have an obtainable Piece field.
      Returns:
      true if the location has a friendly Rook, false if not.

    • underAttack

      private boolean underAttack(List<Coordinate> positions, Tile[][] tiles)
      This helper method is used within the castling helper methods to determine if any of the pieces between the Rook or King may be be attacked. The Rook's coordinate is included as well.
      Parameters:
      positions - a List of Coordinate objects which are the space between the king and the rook, along with the Rook's location
      tiles - a 2D array containing Tile objects which have an obtainable Piece field.
      Returns:
      true if the space between the King and/or the Rook may be attacked by some piece, false if not.

    • setCheck

      public void setCheck()
      This simply sets the king in check, meaning that an enemy piece is currently able to kill it. This method is called whenever the board is updated.

    • checkEvaded

      public void checkEvaded()
      This simply sets the king's check field to false. This method is called whenever the board is updated, and may be called even when the king is not in check.
